Testimonials.title: TESTIMONIALS
Testimonials.subtitle: Read what our 1,000+ customers are saying.

comments.aisssatou: This job board made my job search so much easier. I found a position that matches my skills in less than a week!
comments.koffi: Clean interface, relevant job offers, and easy application process. Love it!
comments.fatoumata: Thanks to this platform, I finally landed my dream job. Forever grateful!
comments.thierno: Great platform for job seekers and companies alike. The filtering options are very helpful.
comments.chantal: I appreciate how the site is available in multiple languages. It really makes job hunting easier for international users.
comments.idriss: As an employer, I was impressed by how quickly we received quality applications. Highly recommended!

FAQ.title: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
FAQ.subtitle: Find answers to the most frequently asked questions

questions.jobSearch: How can I find job listings in Africa?
questions.careerAdvice: Do you provide career advice or CV reviews?
questions.employerPosting: Can employers post job listings on your platform?
questions.contactSupport: How do I contact the support team?

answers.jobSearch: Our platform is designed to connect job seekers with opportunities across Africa. You can browse job listings by category, location, or keyword to find the perfect match for your skills and experience.
answers.careerAdvice: Yes, we offer resources and tips to help you improve your CV and prepare for interviews. Check out our blog and resources section for helpful guides, or contact us for personalized assistance.
answers.employerPosting: Absolutely! Employers can create an account and post job listings to reach qualified candidates. We also offer premium options to highlight your job postings for greater visibility.
answers.contactSupport: You can reach out to us through the contact form on our website, and our team will respond as soon as possible.

EffectiveJobAds.title: Tips for Writing Effective Job Ads
EffectiveJobAds.subtitle: Learn how to craft compelling job advertisements that attract qualified candidates and reduce time-to-hire.

stats.jobSeekers: of job seekers say the job description is extremely influential in their decision to apply
stats.qualifiedApplicants: increase in qualified applicants when salary information is included
stats.fewerApplications: fewer applications from women when job ads use masculine-coded language

specific.title: Be specific
specific.description: Use precise terms to describe the role and expectations.

inclusive.title: Inclusive language
inclusive.description: Use vocabulary that encourages diverse applications.

results.title: Focus on results
results.description: Describe the impact the candidate will have in this role.

concise.title: Be concise
concise.description: Get to the point to keep the reader's attention.

example1.title: Generic vs. Specific
example1.before: We're looking for a hardworking team player who is passionate about marketing.
example1.after: We're seeking a Digital Marketing Specialist with 3+ years of experience in social media campaign management and analytics.

example2.title: Vague vs. Clear Requirements
example2.before: Candidates should have relevant experience and technical skills.
example2.after: Candidates should have 2+ years of Python development experience and familiarity with Django framework.

example3.title: Company-Focused vs. Candidate-Focused
example3.before: Our company needs someone to handle customer inquiries and resolve complaints.
example3.after: You'll help our customers solve their problems, using your excellent communication skills to ensure they feel valued and heard.

basics.foundationTitle: The Foundation of an Effective Job Ad
basics.whyMatterDescription: Your job advertisement is often the first impression candidates have of your company. A well-crafted job ad not only attracts more qualified candidates but also:

benefits.relevantApplicants: Reduces time-to-hire by attracting relevant applicants
benefits.candidateExperience: Improves candidate experience and employer brand
benefits.accurateExpectations: Sets accurate expectations, leading to better retention
benefits.diversity: Promotes diversity and inclusion in your hiring process

basics.elementsTitle: Essential Elements of Every Job Ad

elements.clearDescription: Use industry-standard job titles that candidates are likely to search for. Avoid internal titles or creative names that might confuse candidates.
elements.requirementsDescription: Clearly distinguish between must-have qualifications and nice-to-have ones. Focus on skills and competencies rather than years of experience.
elements.compensationDescription: Include salary range and highlight key benefits. Transparency here increases applications and saves time for both candidates and recruiters.
elements.cultureDescription: Give candidates a glimpse of your workplace culture, values, and what makes your company unique. This helps candidates self-select for cultural fit.

mistakes.tooManyRequirements: Listing too many requirements, which can discourage qualified candidates
mistakes.vagueResponsibilities: Being vague about responsibilities or expectations
mistakes.omittingSalary: Omitting salary information, which reduces applications

structure.title: How to Structure Your Job Ad
structure.description: A well-structured job ad is easier to scan and comprehend. Follow this framework to create clear, candidate-friendly job advertisements.

introduction.title: Engaging Introduction
introduction.description: Start with a compelling hook that gives candidates a reason to be excited about this opportunity.
introduction.example: Join our innovative team and help shape the future of healthcare technology. As a UX Designer at HealthTech, you'll create intuitive interfaces that doctors and patients rely on every day.

company.title: Company Overview
company.description: Provide a brief but compelling description of your company, mission, and culture.
company.example: HealthTech is a fast-growing startup with 50 employees dedicated to improving patient outcomes through technology. Our collaborative team values innovation, empathy, and work-life balance.

role.title: Role Description
role.description: Describe what the person will actually do on a day-to-day basis. Use present tense and 'you' language.
role.example: In this role, you'll work closely with our product and development teams to: • Create wireframes and interactive prototypes • Conduct user testing and incorporate feedback • Collaborate on design systems and accessibility standards

requirements.title: Requirements & Qualifications
requirements.description: Clearly separate must-haves from nice-to-haves. Focus on skills and competencies, not just credentials.
requirements.example: Must-Have Qualifications: • 2+ years of UX design experience • Proficiency with Figma or similar design tools • Portfolio demonstrating user-centered design process Nice-to-Have Qualifications: • Experience in healthcare or medical software • Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG) • Basic understanding of HTML/CSS

benefits.title: Benefits & Compensation
benefits.description: Be transparent about salary range and highlight the most attractive benefits and perks.
benefits.example: Compensation & Benefits: • Salary range: $85,000 - $105,000 based on experience • Comprehensive health insurance (medical, dental, vision) • Flexible working hours and remote options • Professional development budget of $2,000 annually • Company equity package

process.title: Application Process
process.description: Provide clear instructions on how to apply and what to expect. Include a timeline if possible.
process.example: To Apply: Please submit your resume and portfolio link to careers@healthtech.com with 'UX Designer' in the subject line. Application deadline: June 15, 2025. Our interview process includes a portfolio review, design exercise, and team interviews.

structure.checklistDescription: Use this checklist to ensure your job ad is complete:

language.title: Using the Right Language
language.description: The words you choose can significantly impact who applies to your job. Using inclusive, clear language helps attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates.

specific.title: Be Specific
specific.description: Avoid vague terms like 'good communicator' or 'team player.' Instead, describe what these mean in your workplace context.

inclusive.title: Use Inclusive Language
inclusive.description: Avoid gender-coded language and terms that might exclude certain groups. Use tools like a gender decoder to check your job ads.

results.title: Focus on Results
results.description: Describe what the person will achieve rather than just listing tasks. E.g., 'You'll lead projects that increase conversion rates' vs 'Manage projects'.

concise.title: Be Concise
concise.description: Keep your job ad to 300-800 words. Organize information with clear headings to make it scannable.

language.jobTitlesTitle: Job Titles: What Works and What Doesn't
language.biasDescription: Research shows that gendered language in job ads can discourage qualified candidates from applying. Be aware of these common gendered terms:
language.biasConclusion: Use a mix of terms or find neutral alternatives. Consider using a gender decoder tool to check your job ads.
language.directCommunicationDescription: Using 'you' and 'your' language creates a more personal connection with candidates. Compare these approaches:
language.companyFocusedExample: The successful candidate will manage client accounts and be responsible for meeting sales targets.
language.candidateFocusedExample: You'll build strong relationships with clients and use your sales expertise to exceed targets.

examples.title: Before & After Examples
examples.description: See how these job ad snippets transform from generic to compelling with a few key changes.
examples.fullExampleTitle: Full Job Ad Example: Marketing Manager

fullExample.aboutUsText: GreenTech is a growing renewable energy company dedicated to making sustainable technology accessible to all. With 75 employees across three offices, we've been helping households reduce their carbon footprint since 2018. Our inclusive team values innovation, sustainability, and work-life balance.
fullExample.theRoleText: As our new Marketing Manager, you'll lead our marketing strategy to connect sustainable energy solutions with the homeowners who need them. Working with our passionate team, you'll develop campaigns that drive awareness and adoption of renewable energy products.
responsibilities: Develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies across digital and traditional channels
Manage a team of 3 marketing specialists, providing guidance and mentorship
Analyze campaign performance and market trends to optimize marketing ROI
Collaborate with product teams to craft compelling messaging about our solutions
Oversee a quarterly marketing budget of $250,000
requirements: Proven track record developing successful marketing campaigns
Experience managing direct reports and cross-functional teams
Strong analytical skills and data-driven decision making
niceToHaveList: Experience in renewable energy or sustainability sectors
Familiarity with marketing automation tools (HubSpot, Marketo)
benefitsList: Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance
Remote work options with quarterly team retreats
Generous paid time off policy and volunteer days
Employee discount on our sustainable energy products
fullExample.commitmentText: GreenTech is committed to building a diverse team. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences to apply. We're especially keen to hear from candidates from underrepresented groups in the renewable energy sector.
fullExample.toApplyText: Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you're excited about renewable energy and this role to careers@greentech.com. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, with interviews beginning May 15, 2025.
